Ooh! Yes, that's a good one. Actually, even more useful would a 30/60/90deg triangular wedge, as it gives you twice as many new angles to play with.

(I get so frustrated trying to get mount points in the right places so that my spot-lights - sorry, "Illuminator MK I"s - can light up the best/most important features of the ship... They always want to shine straight along the surface they're stuck to, or outward at almost-but-not-quite 90 degrees! =} )

I've attempted to make this before, but there is a limitation in the node system that didn't really allow it.

You're better off just taking a cubic octogonal strut and mounting it at any angle you want with Shift-wasdqe, and then mounting the node-only party to that with clipping.
Not so much for practicality, but I'd like to see a 1.25m two man command pod. Say 3/4 the length of the Fl-T800.
